Articles.Content: This game is avesome i wait for more updates...
I am excited to set up colonies on other planets and travel to other solar systems with the futuristic rockets.
I can't wait to destroy my brothers colonies with random "out of control" rockets.
I'm excited that I will finally be able to play it with family members and friends! I also hope there will be a lot less bugs in KSP2 than KSP1!
Count me in! I am so looking forward to release this Friday, so I'm getting the game one way or another!
I am excited about interstellar travel!
I am excited for the colonies, mainly because long trips to other planets in the system wont have to be done so often.

ERROR

Edited February 23, 2023 by what the heck bro
ERROR CODE:UNKNOWN

I am excited to see what my students are able to design with this, and how this changes the KSP classes I teach.
(I'm an online rocket science teacher, so of course I use KSP in all my classes)

I am exited for the interstellar travel, and multiplayer!

\
I am excited for playing with friends on multiplayer, going interstellar, and going interstellar with friends on multiplayer!

I'm super excited to launch vessels from my colonies and from orbit rather than having to launch them from the surface of Kerbin. I think that will really open up my options when building massive interstellar ships, which I suspect I will do a lot of once other star systems become available later in early access!
Im excited for the scifi esque engines.

I`m excited for all of the things below:

- How far i can push my gaming device while playing ksp2.

- Creating new planets in a mod! (Debug menu seems to contain a "Create Planets" option)

- Fuctional colonies without adding a billion mods are an upside, tho i don`t know how complicated the colonisation system is.

- Interstellar travel without bugs would be fun, especally with far future engines.

Also dres isnt boring anymore, lets see what the most boring planet is!

Edited February 23, 2023 by ffx
Space frogs!
moar procedural wings and far future rocket engines!
Can't wait to pull an all nighter while listening to starman

100%, the colonies. Having to build massive infrastructure systems spanning planets and even solar systems is going to be amazing. I cannot wait to fly a refueling ship built in orbit of Jool from materials/fuel mined on Laythe to refuel a generation ship built at a station in Minmus orbit currently at Dres before it's mission to Deb Deb!

I am excited for the full release of true multiplayer even though it's a bit far down the roadmap. All the unofficial multiplayer mods for KSP 1 relied on save synchronization and provided a laggy sub-par experience. Really looking forward to true engine-supported real-time multiplayer in KSP 2 when it's released.
I'm excited about going interstellar with new engines and colony building tech
Colony and interstellar flight.
interstellar travel has got to be one of my most anticipated feature of KSP2, multiplayer is also pretty neat as well

I am excited to eventually be able to visit different space systems.  I am excited for new parts, custom paint jobs, new interfaces.  I'm also excited to see how long it takes me to surpass my 1500 hours (per Steam) of original KSP gameplay.

personally, i'm excited to make a horrible rocket composed of a flimsy parachute, a one-seat pod, and a solid fuel booster to collect samples of the stratosphere while my kerbal hangs on for dear life outside of the "spaceship"

then, of course, crash my second rocket horribly as it nose-dives into the KSC
I am excited for finally getting new graphics, new gameplay mechanics, new parts, and of course, jeb
